@euclio in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92602#issuecomment-1006751160 I changed the [src] link to the text "source", and also [-] to the text "collapse". You objected to "collapse" so I backed out the change to be discussed later. Let's discuss it now. :-) Also cc @GuillaumeGomez and @Noah Lev who liked the text variant.

If I can try to restate your objections:

  • The "collapse all" item acts like a button. It changes the current page; it doesn't navigate to another page. So it should be styled like a button.
  • [-] is fewer characters than "collapse"
  • "collapse" doesn't match the [-] / [+] buttons elsewhere on the page.

I'd like to propose the text be summary / details. That conveys more of the concept of "this link takes you to a summary page (even if we achieve that by manipulating the current page)." Also I think someday we may actually want to make the summary its own page, which would allow us more flexibility in what we display.

It's true that [-] is fewer characters, but what we're aiming for is not fewer characters but clarity of hierarchy and clear direction of attention. Right now the [-] in "1.0.0 · source · [-]" stands out like a sore thumb. That draws attention to it, when the first place we want to draw people's attention is the item title <h1>, and then down through the docs. On desktop we're not short on space in this position, and as of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92861, we make appropriate room for it on the next line down.

It will still be true that "summary" doesn't look like the [-] / [+] buttons, but I think that's okay. Assuming we switch to ‣ (maybe, maybe not), it would be confusing to have one of those up top, since the visual meaning of that icon is "this will collapse things immediately to its right and below." The "summary" link is a different operation, since it collapses many things.

What do you think?
What do you mean by "summary" btw?
like "1.0.0 · source · summary"
I think I got it. You mean that when it's collapsed, it's the summary right?
Just like that, I don't think having another page only for the summary is a good idea though.
However, maybe we should collapse all doc comments by default?

I think we're getting a little off-topic. My main goal here is to discuss: should the item at the top of the page that collapses all toggles be represented by the icon-like [-] as today? Or should we change it to a word ("collapse", or "summary", or something else)? I'd like to change it to a word.
Whatever the word is, the functionality would be the same. I'm just trying to explain why it's justified to use a word (and a hyperlink) rather than a button.
Oh I see. Sorry. For me, "collapse all"/"show all" seems like that the best choice overall
Or maybe "hide all"?
I think Guillaume's suggestion of "collapse all" and "show all" is a good one, although it is a bit long.
How about "hide details" / "show details"

I prefer [ - ], I think using whole word for this is much more disctracting. What I want to read is the docs themselves, and I want them to jump out of the page at me and everything else to be easy to ignore. Using a word for an action is the opposite of that. It makes it easier to blend in with the title/signature/etc
"details" is a bit vague here imo

Nick Cameron said:

I prefer [ - ], I think using whole word for this is much more disctracting. What I want to read is the docs themselves, and I want them to jump out of the page at me and everything else to be easy to ignore. Using a word for an action is the opposite of that. It makes it easier to blend in with the title/signature/etc

It's only for the global toggle, not for each of them below.
@Nick Cameron Btw, I think @jsha wrote it above but we will very likely make the toggles smaller by using "‣" instead of [-].
I missed that, it would be cool!

Alright, I have a demo up of using words for the global toggle. I went with "hide docs" / "show docs" but am open to feedback about alternate wording:

https://rustdoc.crud.net/jsha/words-for-collapse/std/string/struct.String.html

image.png

What do y'all think? @Andy Russell ?
I think "all" should be somewhere in the name. What about "‣ expand all" and "▼ collapse all"?
Or just "expand all" and "collapse all" without the toggles?

I prefer the toggles, IMO it helps communicate that the link is performing an action instead of linking to another page.

Also, if they match the symbol we use for collapsing and expanding individual docs, they immediately convey that they do the same action
For now we use [+]/[-] though. But if we make the switch, it makes sense.
